figure_1.title: Fig. 1.
figure_1.caption: A, Cardiac magnetic resonance imaging 12/2017 – 3.13 cm mass; B, Magnetic resonance enterography 01/2019 – 3.39 cm mass; C, CT without contrast 08/2021 – 3.88 cm mass; and D, CT without contrast 04/2022 – 4.90 cm mass.

figure_2.title: Fig. 2.
figure_2.caption: Linear growth speed of the paraganglioma.

figure_3.title: Fig. 3.
figure_3.caption: A, Maximal intensity projection of DOTATATE PET showing a single positive uptake corresponding to the aortocaval space mass; B, Axial view of DOTATATE PET at the level of the mass; C, Merged axial view of DOTATATE PET and CT; D, Axial view of CT at the level of the mass; and E, Coronal view of DOTATATE PET. Arrows: paraganglioma.

claims.sentence: Review of subsequent imaging showed gradual growth of this mass (Fig. 1 and 2).

Open in a new tab
A, Cardiac magnetic resonance imaging 12/2017 – 3.13 cm mass; B, Magnetic resonance enterography 01/2019 – 3.39 cm mass; C, CT without contrast 08/2021 – 3.88 cm mass; and D, CT without contrast 04/2022 – 4.90 cm mass.Fig. 2.

DOTATATE positron emission tomography (PET)/CT revealed a soft tissue mass measuring 4.3 × 3.1 × 4.9 cm with intense DOTATATE activity located in the right paravertebral space between the aorta and cava at the level of the second lumbar spine, suspicious for PGL (Fig. 3).
Review of subsequent imaging showed gradual growth of this mass (Fig. 1 and 2).

A, Cardiac magnetic resonance imaging 12/2017 – 3.13 cm mass; B, Magnetic resonance enterography 01/2019 – 3.39 cm mass; C, CT without contrast 08/2021 – 3.88 cm mass; and D, CT without contrast 04/2022 – 4.90 cm mass.Fig. 2.

DOTATATE positron emission tomography (PET)/CT revealed a soft tissue mass measuring 4.3 × 3.1 × 4.9 cm with intense DOTATATE activity located in the right paravertebral space between the aorta and cava at the level of the second lumbar spine, suspicious for PGL (Fig. 3).
Review of subsequent imaging showed gradual growth of this mass (Fig. 1 and 2).
